CatDescriptText: Mrs. Julia Johnson, 317 N. St. Clair St., was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 1, 1958, pg. 9 with question: "Do you believe in corporal (paddling) punishment for students, in the elementary grades, who misbehave? If so, who should mete [sic]  out the punishment-- the teacher or the principal?" answer reads: �No, I don�t think that they should be paddled.  It should be left up to the parents.�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Julia Johnson, wearing light colored herringbone coat with dark collar and plaid head scarf, standing in front of stone tiled wall
